Ask HN: How do you manage version numbers for multi-platform application
text: We have an application that is built for multiple platforms (web, mobile, desktop) from a single code base. We maintain a version number which resembles semantic version, but has specific internal meaning. The version number is user facing to help when submitting feedback or support requests. We keep having conversations about whether the version should always be in sync across platforms. I'm just curious if anyone else has a similar situation and how it is managed.

Ask HN: How to quantify compute in terms of programs?
text:
This might be what a "flop" is when thinking of GPUs.

My question is aimed at microcontrollers. If you want to know what it can do, when seeing specs like 80Mhz, 1MB ram/flash, 32bit CPU.

What could you do with that?

I don't think it's possible or at least not sure how to self-write C++ after compiling. That would be interesting.

Or make sub functions that are compiled however can be combined to do more things.

Ask HN: How did you move from hourly to flat project rate?
text:
Motivated by the "what's your hourly rate?" poll. There's the famous patio11 post[0] that talks about charging flat rates rather than hourly. I've had some scattered success with this but I'd like to do it a lot more often. There's a wealth of general advice, (esp on Patrick's blog) but contextualizing that with personal stories would be very helpful

For those who have made the transition from hourly to flat rate, how did you get there? For those who tried and found it wasn't effective for you, what do you think the major sticking point was?

[0]https://www.kalzumeus.com/2015/05/01/talking-about-money/
